result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristie Ann Hoyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kristie Ann Hoyer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kristie Ann Hoyer was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for probation by 8/31/22.
- 4 days credit against ultimate sentence.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: any current status.

miscConds.notes:
- $268 Court Costs. Payable through probation on Count 1 in St. Croix County case 22CF171.
- $250 DNA Surcharge. Payable through probation on Count 1 in St. Croix County case 22CF171.
- AODA and follow through with recommendations.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- No contact with Fleet Farm in Hudson, WI.

- Provide DNA sample.
- Pay supervision fees.

9:34 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Kristie Ann Hoyer in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Kristie Ann Hoyer.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Satorius recites joint agreement.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- Possession of Methamphetamine in 22CF171. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Court notes a prelim has never been held.  Atty Satorius goes over rights with DE.  DE waives PH.  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court continues with PLEAS. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CF171.  On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 & 3 in 22CF171.  Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: Ct 1 in 22CF171

S/W 2 Years Probation, Concurrent with any Current Status

- Court Costs: $268.00    
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250.00
  Balance to be pd through probation

Conditions of Probation:

- AODA and follow through 
- Absolute sobriety
- No Contact with Fleet Farm in Hudson WI
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation this morning, 8/31/22

4 days credit against ultimate sentence

Adjourned at 10:00 AM

Pretrial assessment report. sealed. arc
Pretrial Assessement report. Sealed. arc
Preliminary hearing on May 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

- Defendant to test before release. Baseline. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Fleet Farm in Hudson, WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.  I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing at least 1 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.
